intro: Atriplex babingtonii, commonly known as sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, lobed leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It has a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh, dry conditions. Atriplex babingtonii is also known for its ability to stabilize soil and is sometimes used in restoration projects.
